Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should close Guantanamo Bay detention camp", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: It helps protect the usa as the terrorist are not in the usa so certain laws wont apply to these people.<sep>Keypoint: The guantanamo bay detention camp is essential to gain intelligence
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that it helps protect the usa as the terrorist are not in the usa so certain laws wont apply to these people.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Prisoners are subjected to practices and conditions that are regarded as inhumane<sep>Keypoint: The guantanamo bay detention camp personnel commit crimes against the prisoners
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that prisoners are subjected to practices and conditions that are regarded as inhumane

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Guantanamo bay provides intelligence information that may crack terrorist cells and prevent future attacks.<sep>Keypoint: The guantanamo bay detention camp is better for prisoners than the alternatives
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that guantanamo bay provides intelligence information that may crack terrorist cells and prevent future attacks.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Whatever public diplomacy advantage may be achieved by closing the facility would be offset by the damage done to national security<sep>Keypoint: Closing the guantanamo bay detention camp would harm national security
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that whatever public diplomacy advantage may be achieved by closing the facility would be offset by the damage done to national security

Negative Examples.input: Argument: We should keep guantanamo bay detection camp open because one of the most guarded prisons and can hold the baddest criminals<sep>Keypoint: The guantanamo bay detention camp is essential to gain intelligence
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that we should keep guantanamo bay detection camp open because one of the most guarded prisons and can hold the baddest criminals

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Guantanamo bay detection camp offers an essential form of law enforcement and imprisonment for serious criminals and has provided important intelligence in ongoing surveillance.<sep>Keypoint: The guantanamo bay detention camp is essential to gain intelligence
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that guantanamo bay detection camp offers an essential form of law enforcement and imprisonment for serious criminals and has provided important intelligence in ongoing surveillance.
